intro: Pedicularis lasiophrys var. typica, commonly known as the flame-colored lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in association with other herbaceous plants. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach up to 30 centimeters in height.
